com.cyc.query

Interface QuerySpecification<T extends QuerySpecification>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ModifiableQuerySpecification<T>, Query

    public interface QuerySpecification<T extends QuerySpecification>
    QuerySpecification is designed to represent queries posed to Cyc. Information about the processing of a query is represented by Query, which extends this interface.
    See Also:
    ModifiableQuerySpecification

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<String> getCategories()
      Returns the categories to which this query belongs.
      Context getContext()
      Returns the Context of this Query.
      KbIndividual getId()
      For saved queries (aka "KBQs") this returns the Cyc term that identifies the query.
      InferenceParameterGetter getInferenceParameters()
      Returns the inference parameters for this query.
      Sentence getOriginalQuerySentence()
      Returns the Sentence used to create this Query.
      Sentence getQuerySentence()
      Returns the Sentence which will be asked of Cyc, after all substitutions have been applied.
      Sentence getQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause() 
      Sentence getQuerySentenceMainClause()

      Returns a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are sought.
      QueryRules getRules()
      Returns a QueryRules object which provides access to the rules for the query.
      Map<KbObject,Object> getSubstitutions()
      Returns a map of the substitutions which have already been applied to the current query.
      Set<KbObject> getUnresolvedIndexicals()
      Returns a set of all remaining #$IndexicalConcepts which the application must resolve before the query can be run.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        KbIndividual getId()
        For saved queries (aka "KBQs") this returns the Cyc term that identifies the query. To change the id of an existing query, see ModifiableQuerySpecification.saveAs(String)
        Returns:
        the id term

      • getOriginalQuerySentence

        Sentence getOriginalQuerySentence()
                           throws KbException
        Returns the Sentence used to create this Query. Unless the sentence is changed via ModifiableQuerySpecification.setQuerySentence(com.cyc.kb.Sentence), this method will return exactly the same Sentence every time it is called. Any substitutions made on the query sentence (see getSubstitutions()) will be reflected in a copy of this sentence, accessible via getQuerySentence().
        Returns:
        Throws:
        KbException

      • getQuerySentence

        Sentence getQuerySentence()
                   throws KbException
        Returns the Sentence which will be asked of Cyc, after all substitutions have been applied. In other words, this method essentially returns the value of getOriginalQuerySentence() after ModifiableQuerySpecification.setSubstitutions(java.util.Map) has been invoked.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        KbException

      • getContext

        Context getContext()
        Returns the Context of this Query.
        Returns:
        the Context of this Query

      • getInferenceParameters

        InferenceParameterGetter getInferenceParameters()
        Returns the inference parameters for this query.

        For convenience, several of the most commonly used inference parameters may be also accessed from getters and setters which are directly on the Query object. Those parameters are:

        • inferenceMode (:INFERENCE-MODE)
        • maxAnswerCount (:MAX-NUMBER)
        • maxTime (:MAX-TIME)
        • maxTransformationDepth (:MAX-TRANSFORMATION-DEPTH)
        Returns:
        the inference parameters

      • getSubstitutions

        Map<KbObject,Object> getSubstitutions()
        Returns a map of the substitutions which have already been applied to the current query.
        Returns:
        the substitutions which have been applied to the current query
        See Also:
        com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#setSubstitutions(java.util.Map), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#addSubstitutions(java.util.Map), getUnresolvedIndexicals(), com.cyc.query.Indexicals

      • getCategories

        Collection<String> getCategories()
        Returns the categories to which this query belongs. Categories are associated with queries via ModifiableQuerySpecification#addCategory().
        Returns:
        the categories to which this query belongs.

      • getRules

        QueryRules getRules()
             throws QueryConstructionException,
                    KbException
        Returns a QueryRules object which provides access to the rules for the query.
        Returns:
        the QueryRules for the query
        Throws:
        QueryConstructionException
        KbException

      • getQuerySentenceMainClause

        Sentence getQuerySentenceMainClause()
                             throws KbException
        Returns:
        Throws:

      • getQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause

        Sentence getQuerySentenceHypothesizedClause()
                                     throws KbException
        Returns:
        Throws:
        KbException

      • getQueryVariables

        Set<Variable> getQueryVariables()
                         throws KbException
        Returns a Collection of the variables in this query for which bindings are sought. Note that this is a copy of the variables, and modification of the returned value will not result in modifications of the underlying Query.

        This method is essentially a trampoline to #getQuerySentence()#getVariables() .

        Returns:
        a Set of the variables in this query for which bindings are to be sought
        Throws:
        KbException

      • getUnresolvedIndexicals

        Set<KbObject> getUnresolvedIndexicals()
                               throws KbException,
                                      SessionCommunicationException
        Returns a set of all remaining #$IndexicalConcepts which the application must resolve before the query can be run. As such, this set does not include automatically-resolvable indexicals, or indexicals which have already been resolved by substitutions previously added to the Query.

        This method is essentially a trampoline to #getQuerySentence()#getIndexicals() . To get all of the indexicals for a Query (unresolved or not) see #getOriginalQuerySentence()#getIndexicals(boolean) .

        For a brief overview of indexicals, see KbObject.isIndexical().

        Returns:
        the indexicals for a query
        Throws:
        KbException
        SessionCommunicationException
        See Also:
        KbObject.isIndexical(), Sentence.getIndexicals(boolean), Sentence.replaceTerms(java.util.Map), com.cyc.query.QuerySpecification#addSubstitutions(java.util.Map), getSubstitutions()
